lines.text: Do you feel you compromised your dream?
No.
How do you feel?
Trapped. Which isn't bad for the end of a musical comedy.
And then it happened. Suddenly, shamelessly, and without warning, as it must in all musical comedies, they were struck by... a love song.
Sometimes I wonder if the fornicating I'm getting is worth the fornicating I'm getting.
he is strong and stupid.
Sometimes I think men raise flags when they can't get anything else up.
Look at her, Pippin! She has a mole! You're willing to spend the rest of your life with a woman who has a MOLE!

Think about the sun, Pippin... think about her golden glance. How she lights the world up - well, now it's your chance! With the guardians of splendor inviting you to dance... Pippin. Think about the sun.
When I help others, I'm really helping myself!
Lewis is strong. Lewis loves fighting. Lewis loves wrestling. But most of all, Lewis loves Lewis.

Sweet summer evenings, sapphire skies, feasting your belly, feasting your eyes. Simple joys have a simple voice that says time is living's prize. And wouldn't you rather be a left-handed flea, a crab on a slab at the bottom of the sea, a newt on the root of a banyan tree, a fig on twig in Galilee, than a man who never learns how to be free?
GLORY'S IN THE AIR! GLORY'S IN THE AIR! AND WHAT AM I DOING? I'm running around in a dark stage like an Idiot.
You're supposed to read the line "naggingly!"
He put his hand on my thigh, they've never done that before ...
I don't care where he puts his hand!
I know this is a musical comedy, but I want my life to have meaning!
(Song lyrics) Rivers belong where they can ramble/ Eagles belong where they can fly/ I've got to be where my spirit can run free/ Gotta find my corner of the sky.
[after a seemingly incinerated man steps forward unharmed]
That's the finale? It was just a trick.
Well, when he did it, it was a trick. When you do it, it'll be real.
